pageContext.claim: “[Trump is asked, ‘Did you tell your Chief of Staff to have NOAA disavow those forecasters who said that Alabama was not in the path of the storm?’] No, I never did that. I never did that. That's a whole hoax by the fake-news media, when they talk about the hurricane and when they talk about Florida, and they talk about Alabama. That's just fake news. It was, right from the beginning, it was a fake story.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a falsehood on top of a falsehood. Senior administration officials said "President Trump told his staff that the nation’s leading weather forecasting agency needed to correct a statement that contradicted a tweet the president had sent wrongly claiming that Hurricane Dorian threatened Alabama." By the time Trump made public comments warning that a storm could hit Alabama, forecasters had already ruled out that possibility. It is against the law to spread false weather reports.
